RT @JanaLMorgan That's it for the #S1TownHall on People Powered Elections and the For the People Act! Thank you to @RepMondaire @FredWertheimer @thetrevorpotter  @IanVandewalker @Joanne_Antoine for joining us.

A7: In communities with small-donor matching programs, candidates spend more time engaging everyday people about the issues that matter to them and less time asking wealthy donors for money.

This is about creating a government that is truly by and for We, the People. #S1TownHall https://twitter.com/JanaLMorgan/status/1377317861459394564 QT @JanaLMorgan Q7: A lot of #S1 is based on existing policies around the country, including the small-donor program. How have these worked in places they‚Äôve been implemented? How have people-powered elections led to policy wins that benefit everyday Americans? #S1TownHall @DFADcoalition

A6: Congress isn‚Äôt just funded by wealthy people ‚Äî it‚Äôs full of them. This is because our broken campaign finance system is rigged to favor wealthy candidates.

Small-donor financing gives power back to the people so they can help elect the candidates that truly represent them. https://twitter.com/JanaLMorgan/status/1377315094401531908 QT @JanaLMorgan Q6: How will small donor financing help more women, young people, and people of color run for office? How will this help create a government that represents and reflects the people? #S1TownHall @DFADcoalition

To build a true democracy, we need to make sure that our politicians listen to us, the people ‚Äî not just their biggest donors. 

With small-donor matching, candidates who have historically been excluded from electoral politics can run people-powered campaigns and win. #S1TownHall https://twitter.com/JanaLMorgan/status/1377312967092494337 QT @JanaLMorgan Q5: Reforms in #ForThePeopleAct will make it easier for candidates to run campaigns funded by small donors, not PACs and wealthy donors. How will this help counter the corrupting influence of big money in politics? #S1TownHall @DFADcoalition

A4: The small-donor matching program in #S1 doesn‚Äôt use a single taxpayer dollar. Instead, the program is funded entirely by fines and penalties paid by big corporations who break the law. It‚Äôs a win-win. #S1TownHall https://twitter.com/JanaLMorgan/status/1377310649978650627 QT @JanaLMorgan Q4: Opponents of the #ForThePeopleAct have spread misinformation about the small donor reforms in #S1. How does the bill actually fund this program? #S1TownHall @DFADcoalition

A3: Small-donor matching is simple: for every dollar a person donates up to $200, public financing matches that dollar with $6. 

That means a $50 donation becomes a $350 donation, giving small-dollar donors the power to make a real difference in our elections. #S1TownHall https://twitter.com/JanaLMorgan/status/1377309126791983110 QT @JanaLMorgan Q3: How does the #ForThePeopleAct (#S1) empower small donors and encourage more people to participate in our democracy? #S1TownHall @DFADcoalition

Too often, big-dollar donors drive the outcome of so many elections, helping the wealthy and well-connected control our government. 

By establishing public campaign financing, the #ForThePeopleAct would help elect more working people, women, people of color, and young people. https://twitter.com/JanaLMorgan/status/1377307620688736264 QT @JanaLMorgan Q2: The 2020 election was the most expensive in history. How does the #ForThePeopleAct (#S1) address the increasing role big money in politics plays in elections?

A1: As part of the most diverse Congress in U.S. history, I know we're close to creating an inclusive, equitable democracy. 

But we're not there yet. We need a system that empowers people of color, working people, and everyone else our politics has excluded. A true democracy. https://twitter.com/JanaLMorgan/status/1377305022401290257 QT @JanaLMorgan Q1: Tell us about your work to create a more inclusive and representative democracy and why that is so important. #S1TownHall @DFADcoalition

The #AmericanJobsPlan is a game-changer and full of ideas that progressives like me are fighting for to make long-overdue investments in America‚Äôs future.

I‚Äôve also called for a Real Corporate Profits Tax to ensure that giant companies that report billions of dollars in profits don‚Äôt exploit loopholes to pay close to nothing in taxes. President Biden‚Äôs plan includes a version of this policy.

I‚Äôve got lots of ways to make big corporations and the ultra-rich pay their fair share for these investments, like raising the top corporate tax rate, stopping tax haven abuse and offshoring, and bolstering the IRS. The President's plan includes all these ideas.

And I announced a bill with @RepAndyLevin to use the enormous purchasing power of the US government to kick-start demand for American-made clean energy products and create good jobs. President Biden‚Äôs plan is a good first step toward the goal.

My #BuildGreen Act would electrify our public transportation to create jobs, modernize our crumbling infrastructure, and fight the #ClimateCrisis. President Biden‚Äôs proposal has the first round of funding we need to make our plan a reality.

I‚Äôve introduced a housing bill to build millions of new housing units, and a bill to take care of our badly-needed public housing repairs. President Biden‚Äôs plan gets us a good part of the way there to create jobs and make housing more affordable.

I‚Äôve been sounding the alarm long before COVID about the big, structural investments that we need to make child care part of our basic infrastructure. President Biden‚Äôs plan invests in child care facilities and availability, a good first step on the path to universal care.
